def.threejs.three

Class WebGLRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • def.js.Object
      • def.threejs.three.Renderer
        • def.threejs.three.WebGLRenderer

  • public class WebGLRenderer
extends Renderer
    The WebGL renderer displays your beautifully crafted scenes using WebGL, if your device supports it. This renderer has way better performance than CanvasRenderer.
    See Also:
    src/renderers/WebGLRenderer.js

    • Field Detail

      • domElement

        public def.dom.HTMLCanvasElement domElement
        A Canvas where the renderer draws its output. This is automatically created by the renderer in the constructor (if not provided already); you just need to add it to your page.

      • context

        public def.dom.WebGLRenderingContext context
        The HTML5 Canvas's 'webgl' context obtained from the canvas where the renderer will draw.

      • autoClear

        public Boolean autoClear
        Defines whether the renderer should automatically clear its output before rendering.

      • autoClearColor

        public Boolean autoClearColor
        If autoClear is true, defines whether the renderer should clear the color buffer. Default is true.

      • autoClearDepth

        public Boolean autoClearDepth
        If autoClear is true, defines whether the renderer should clear the depth buffer. Default is true.

      • autoClearStencil

        public Boolean autoClearStencil
        If autoClear is true, defines whether the renderer should clear the stencil buffer. Default is true.

      • sortObjects

        public Boolean sortObjects
        Defines whether the renderer should sort objects. Default is true.

      • clippingPlanes

        public Object[] clippingPlanes

      • localClippingEnabled

        public Boolean localClippingEnabled

      • extensions

        public WebGLExtensions extensions

      • gammaInput

        public Boolean gammaInput
        Default is false.

        Default is false.

        public Boolean physicallyCorrectLights

        public ToneMapping toneMapping

      • shadowMapDebug

        public Boolean shadowMapDebug
        Default is false.

      • maxMorphTargets

        public double maxMorphTargets
        Default is 8.

      • maxMorphNormals

        public double maxMorphNormals
        Default is 4.

      • info

        public WebGLRenderer.Info info
        An object with a series of statistical information about the graphics board memory and the rendering process. Useful for debugging or just for the sake of curiosity. The object contains the following fields:

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebGLRenderer

        public WebGLRenderer(WebGLRendererParameters parameters)
        parameters is an optional object with properties defining the renderer's behaviour. The constructor also accepts no parameters at all. In all cases, it will assume sane defaults when parameters are missing.

      • WebGLRenderer

        public WebGLRenderer()
        parameters is an optional object with properties defining the renderer's behaviour. The constructor also accepts no parameters at all. In all cases, it will assume sane defaults when parameters are missing.

        public void setSize(double width,
                    double height,
                    Boolean updateStyle)

      • setScissor

        public void setScissor(double x,
                       double y,
                       double width,
                       double height)
        Sets the scissor area from (x, y) to (x + width, y + height).

      • setScissorTest

        public void setScissorTest(Boolean enable)
        Enable the scissor test. When this is enabled, only the pixels within the defined scissor area will be affected by further renderer actions.

      • getClearColor

        public Color getClearColor()
        Returns a THREE.Color instance with the current clear color.

                          double alpha)

        public void renderBufferImmediate(Object3D object,

                                  Material material)
        Tells the shadow map plugin to update using the passed scene and camera parameters.

        scene - an instance of Scene
        camera - — an instance of Camera

      • renderBufferDirect

        public void renderBufferDirect(Camera camera,
                               Fog fog,
                               Material material,
                               Object geometryGroup,
                               Object3D object)

      • render

        public void render(Scene scene,
                   Camera camera,
                   RenderTarget renderTarget,
                   Boolean forceClear)
        Render a scene using a camera. The render is done to the renderTarget (if specified) or to the canvas as usual. If forceClear is true, the canvas will be cleared before rendering, even if the renderer's autoClear property is false.

      • setFaceCulling

        public void setFaceCulling(CullFace cullFace,
                           FrontFaceDirection frontFace)
        Used for setting the gl frontFace, cullFace states in the GPU, thus enabling/disabling face culling when rendering. If cullFace is false, culling will be disabled.
        Parameters:
        cullFace - "back", "front", "front_and_back", or false.
        frontFace - "ccw" or "cw

      • render

        public void render(Scene scene,
                   Camera camera)
        Render a scene using a camera. The render is done to the renderTarget (if specified) or to the canvas as usual. If forceClear is true, the canvas will be cleared before rendering, even if the renderer's autoClear property is false.
        Overrides:
        render in class Renderer

      • setFaceCulling

        public void setFaceCulling(CullFace cullFace)
        Used for setting the gl frontFace, cullFace states in the GPU, thus enabling/disabling face culling when rendering. If cullFace is false, culling will be disabled.
        Parameters:
        cullFace - "back", "front", "front_and_back", or false.
        frontFace - "ccw" or "cw

      • setFaceCulling

        public void setFaceCulling()
        Used for setting the gl frontFace, cullFace states in the GPU, thus enabling/disabling face culling when rendering. If cullFace is false, culling will be disabled.
        Parameters:
        cullFace - "back", "front", "front_and_back", or false.
        frontFace - "ccw" or "cw
